## Classes Index

<MembersIndex>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bpfunctionnode">BPFunctionNode</a></>}>
A function with a set of utility nodes where it is beneficial to order two functions close together if they have similar utility nodes. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bpfunctionnode/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="struct"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/balancedpartitioningconfig">BalancedPartitioningConfig</a></>}>
Algorithm parameters; default values are tuned on real-world binaries. <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/balancedpartitioningconfig/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/balancedpartitioning">BalancedPartitioning</a></>}>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="struct"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/balancedpartitioning/bpthreadpool">BPThreadPool</a></>}>
A special ThreadPool that allows for spawning new tasks after blocking on wait(). <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/balancedpartitioning/bpthreadpool/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="struct"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/balancedpartitioning/utilitysignature">UtilitySignature</a></>}>
The signature of a particular utility node used for the bisection step, i.e., the number of <code>FunctionNodes</code> in each of the two buckets. <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/balancedpartitioning/utilitysignature/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

</MembersIndex>

<ProgramListing>

<Link id="l00001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===- BalancedPartitioning.h ---------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This file implements BalancedPartitioning, a recursive balanced graph</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// partitioning algorithm.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The algorithm is used to find an ordering of FunctionNodes while optimizing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// a specified objective. The algorithm uses recursive bisection; it starts</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// with a collection of unordered FunctionNodes and tries to split them into</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// two sets (buckets) of equal cardinality. Each bisection step is comprised of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// iterations that greedily swap the FunctionNodes between the two buckets while</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// there is an improvement of the objective. Once the process converges, the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// problem is divided into two sub-problems of half the size, which are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// recursively applied for the two buckets. The final ordering of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// FunctionNodes is obtained by concatenating the two (recursively computed)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// orderings.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// In order to speed up the computation, we limit the depth of the recursive</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// tree by a specified constant (SplitDepth) and apply at most a constant</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// number of greedy iterations per split (IterationsPerSplit). The worst-case</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// time complexity of the implementation is bounded by O(M&#42;log^2 N), where</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// N is the number of FunctionNodes and M is the number of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// FunctionNode-UtilityNode edges; (assuming that any collection of D</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// FunctionNodes contains O(D) UtilityNodes). Notice that the two different</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// recursive sub-problems are independent and thus can be efficiently processed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// in parallel.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Reference:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   &#42; Optimizing Function Layout for Mobile Applications,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     https://arxiv.org/abs/2211.09285</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#ifndef LLVM&#95;SUPPORT&#95;BALANCED&#95;PARTITIONING&#95;H</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#define LLVM&#95;SUPPORT&#95;BALANCED&#95;PARTITIONING&#95;H</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlight">      : <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bpfunctionnode/#a3d90e99c1d3fa2cb1f6d0ba9884e208b">Id</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bpfunctionnode/#a3d90e99c1d3fa2cb1f6d0ba9884e208b">Id</a>), <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bpfunctionnode/#aa42fe685455d68a6deb4ea09a49223c3">UtilityNodes</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/bpfunctionnode/#aa42fe685455d68a6deb4ea09a49223c3">UtilityNodes</a>) &#123;&#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/balancedpartitioningconfig"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/balancedpartitioningconfig">BalancedPartitioningConfig</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The depth of the recursive bisection</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/balancedpartitioningconfig/#a4a70535c05f2cf437b788d7e02a59d76"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/balancedpartitioningconfig/#a4a70535c05f2cf437b788d7e02a59d76">SplitDepth</a> = 18;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The maximum number of bp iterations per split</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/balancedpartitioningconfig/#ad5c007c3ba8068e408099814e1b3558e"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/balancedpartitioningconfig/#ad5c007c3ba8068e408099814e1b3558e">IterationsPerSplit</a> = 40;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The probability for a vertex to skip a move from its current bucket to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// another bucket; it often helps to escape from a local optima</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/balancedpartitioningconfig/#a79b106f6d64abf9f0bcab25728d2bd82"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">float</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/balancedpartitioningconfig/#a79b106f6d64abf9f0bcab25728d2bd82">SkipProbability</a> = 0.1f;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Recursive subtasks up to the given depth are added to the queue and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// distributed among threads by ThreadPool; all subsequent calls are executed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// on the same thread</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/balancedpartitioningconfig/#abbb5f17251e59b20bc5aa876f7c60e0f"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/balancedpartitioningconfig/#abbb5f17251e59b20bc5aa876f7c60e0f">TaskSplitDepth</a> = 9;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">private</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight">UtilitySignature;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">using </span><span class="doxyHighlight">SignaturesT = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;UtilitySignature, 4&gt;</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">using </span><span class="doxyHighlight">FunctionNodeRange =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/iterator-range">iterator&#95;range&lt;std::vector&lt;BPFunctionNode&gt;::iterator</a>&gt;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// A special ThreadPool that allows for spawning new tasks after blocking on</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// wait(). BalancedPartitioning recursively spawns new threads inside other</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// threads, so we need to track how many active threads that could spawn more</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// threads.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight">BPThreadPool &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/threadpoolinterface">ThreadPoolInterface</a> &amp;TheThreadPool;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlight">    std::mutex mtx;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlight">    std::condition&#95;variable cv;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// The number of threads that could spawn more threads</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlight">    std::atomic&lt;int&gt; NumActiveThreads = 0;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Only true when all threads are down spawning new threads</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> IsFinishedSpawning = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Asynchronous submission of the task to the pool</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Func&gt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> async(Func &amp;&amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// Blocking wait for all threads to complete. Unlike ThreadPool, it is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// acceptable for other threads to add more tasks while blocking on this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// call.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> wait();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlight">    BPThreadPool(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/threadpoolinterface">ThreadPoolInterface</a> &amp;TheThreadPool)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlight">        : TheThreadPool(TheThreadPool) &#123;&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Run a recursive bisection of a given list of FunctionNodes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param RecDepth the current depth of recursion</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param RootBucket the initial bucket of the dataVertices</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param Offset the assigned buckets are the range &#91;Offset, Offset +</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Nodes.size()&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> bisect(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> FunctionNodeRange Nodes, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> RecDepth,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><span class="doxyHighlight">              </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> RootBucket, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a05f5b9a11bdcc5feba62899f95dcf878a3134224cba2545bc57954d3b072aebb4">Offset</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><span class="doxyHighlight">              std::optional&lt;BPThreadPool&gt; &amp;TP) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Run bisection iterations</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlight">                     </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> RightBucket, std::mt19937 &amp;RNG) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Run a bisection iteration to improve the optimization goal</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\returns the total number of moved FunctionNodes</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The signature of a particular utility node used for the bisection step,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// i.e., the number of \\p FunctionNodes in each of the two buckets</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight">UtilitySignature &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// The number of \\p FunctionNodes in the left bucket</span></CodeLine>
